ğŸ“– Vol 1: Etiquette of Quran Recitation
And the Spirit (Ruh) also comes in the Quran with many meanings, so we will not prolong by mentioning them. Likewise, ambiguity may occur in the letters, like His saying, the Mighty and Majestic: 'So they raise with it dust, then penetrate with it the gathering' (Quran 100:4-5). The first 'it' (hi) is a metaphor for the hooves, and they are the ones that kindle (al-muriyat), meaning they raise with the hooves dust. And the second 'it' (hi) is a metaphor for the raid, and they are the raiders at dawn (al-mughirat subhan), so they penetrate with it the gathering, the gathering of the polytheists, and they raided with their gathering.

So how would you be if you witnessed the matters and the graves were overturned and what is in the chests (Sudur) was extracted and you were stopped for the accounting before the Majestic King (Al-Malik Al-Jalil), and the hearts (Qulub) flew from their fear of past sins, and the veils (Hujub) and curtains (AstÄr) were torn from you, and your faults (Ê¿UyÅ«b) and secrets (AsrÄr) appeared? There, every soul (Nafs) will be recompensed for what it earned. Indeed, Allah, the Exalted and Majestic, says: "That He may recompense those who did evil with what they did, and recompense those who did good with the best reward" (Quran 53:31), and He, the Exalted, says: "And the Record will be placed, and you will see the criminals fearful of what is in it" (Quran 83:20). May Allah make us and you doers of His Book, followers of His allies, until He settles us and you in the Abode of Permanence (DÄr al-MaqÄmah) from His bounty. Indeed, He is Praiseworthy, Glorious.
